title: Rolling - rotational KE of sphere on incline

content.question: A hollow sphere is released from rest on an incline from an initial vertical height <math alttext="h sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> above the bottom of the incline. The hollow sphere has mass <math alttext="M sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, radius <math alttext="R sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, and rotational inertia <math alttext="I sub 0 equals, two thirds M sub 0, end sub, times R sub 0, end sub, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, and rolls without slipping down the incline. What is the rotational kinetic energy of the sphere when it reaches the bottom of the incline?

choices.label: <math alttext="one third M sub 0, end sub, times g h sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>g</mi><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="two fifths M sub 0, end sub, times g h sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>g</mi><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="three fifths M sub 0, end sub, times g h sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>g</mi><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="two thirds M sub 0, end sub, times g h sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>g</mi><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="two fifths M sub 0, end sub, times g h sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>g</mi><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
